required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase I/II Study of hLL1 in Multiple Myeloma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/II Study of Immunotherapy With hLL1 Administered Twice Weekly for 4 Consecutive Weeks in Patients With Multiple Myeloma

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase I/II, open-label, multi-center study conducted in patients with recurrent or refractory multiple myeloma who have failed at least two prior standard systemic treatments.

detailed_description.textblock: All patients receive hLL1 administered intravenously twice weekly for 4 consecutive weeks. Cohorts of 3-6 patients will receive escalating doses of hLL1 in order to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) for this administration schedule. Up to approximately 30 additional patients will be entered at one or more dose levels at or below the MTD in order to determine the optimal dose for subsequent studies.

primary_outcome.measure: safety and tolerability of hLL1 administered twice weekly for 4 consecutive weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: The secondary objectives are to obtain information on efficacy, pharmacodynamics, pharmacokinetics, and immunogenicity, and to determine the optimal dose for subsequent studies.

intervention.description: twice weekly dosing for 4 weeks, total of 8 doses

facility.name: New York Presbyterian Hospital/Cornell Medical Center
